text: data data frame containing data plot x Column name x-axis/circles. Character/factor column expected. x_sep Separator concatenating multiple x columns. group_by Column name(s) grouping data (lines). Character/factor column(s) expected. group_by_sep Separator concatenating multiple group_by columns. y Column name y-axis. Numeric column expected. NULL, counts x-axis column group used. group_name Legend title groups. scale_y scale y-axis. Options: "group", "global", "x", "none". "group": Scale fraction within group "global": Scale fraction total "x": Scale fraction within x-axis group "none": Use raw counts/values y_min Minimum value y-axis. y_max Maximum value y-axis. y_nbreaks Number breaks y-axis. bg_color Background color plot. bg_alpha Transparency background color. fill Fill polygons colors. linewidth Width lines. pt_size Size points. max_charwidth Maximum character width x labels. split_by Column name(s) split data multiple plots split_by_sep Separator concatenating multiple split_by columns facet_by Column name(s) faceting plot facet_scales Scales facets: "fixed", "free", "free_x", "free_y" facet_nrow Number rows facet layout facet_ncol Number columns facet layout facet_byrow Fill facets row (TRUE) column (FALSE) theme Theme name (string) theme function theme_args List arguments passed theme function palette Color palette name palcolor Custom colors palette alpha Transparency level (0-1) aspect.ratio Aspect ratio plot panel legend.position Legend position: "none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top" legend.direction Legend direction: "horizontal" "vertical" title Plot title subtitle Plot subtitle seed Random seed reproducibility combine Whether combine split plots one nrow Number rows combining plots ncol Number columns combining plots byrow Fill combined plots row axes handle axes combined plots ("keep", "collect", "collect_x", "collect_y") axis_titles handle axis titles combined plots guides handle guides combined plots ("collect", "keep", "auto") design Custom layout design combined plots polygon Draw polygons instead circles panel grid.

title: Sankey / Alluvial Plot ‚Äî SankeyPlot
text: data data frame following possible formats: "long" "lodes": long format columns x, stratum, alluvium, y. x (required, single columns concatenated x_sep) column name plot x-axis, stratum (defaults links_fill_by) column name group nodes x, alluvium (required) column name define links, y frequency x, stratum, alluvium. "wide" "alluvia": wide format columns x. x (required, multiple columns, x_sep used) columns plot x-axis, stratum alluvium ignored. See ggalluvial::to_lodes_form details. "counts": format counts provides x. x (required, multiple columns, x_sep used) columns plot x-axis. first element x ".", values links_fill_by (required) added plot first column nodes. useful show links flowed source targets. "auto" (default): Automatically determine format based columns provided. length x greater 1 x columns numeric, "counts" format used. length x greater 1 ggalluvial::is_alluvia_form returns TRUE, "alluvia" format used. Otherwise, "lodes" format tried. in_form character string specify format data. Possible values "auto", "long", "lodes", "wide", "alluvia", "counts". x character string column name plot x-axis. See data details. x_sep character string concatenate columns x, multiple columns provided. y character string column name plot y-axis. in_form "counts", y ignored. Otherwise, defaults count x, stratum, alluvium links_fill_by. stratum character string column name group nodes x. See data details. stratum_sep character string concatenate columns stratum, multiple columns provided. alluvium character string column name define links. See data details. alluvium_sep character string concatenate columns alluvium, multiple columns provided. split_by Column name(s) split data multiple plots split_by_sep Separator concatenating multiple split_by columns keep_empty logical value keep empty nodes. flow logical value use ggalluvial::geom_flow instead ggalluvial::geom_alluvium. expand Expansion values axes (CSS-like: top, right, bottom, left) nodes_legend Controls legend nodes shown. Possible values : "merge": Merge legends nodes. one legend shown nodes. "separate": Show legends nodes separately. , nodes x legend. "none": show legend nodes. "auto": Automatically determine show legend. nodes_label TRUE, "none" apply. nodes_label FALSE, stratum links_fill_by, "none" apply. overlapping values nodes different x, "merge" apply. Otherwise, "separate" apply. nodes_color character string color nodes. Use special value ".fill" use color fill. links_fill_by character string column name fill links. links_fill_by_sep character string concatenate columns links_fill_by, multiple columns provided. links_name character string name legend links. links_color character string color borders links. Use special value ".fill" use color fill. nodes_palette character string specify palette nodes fill. nodes_palcolor character vector specify colors nodes fill. nodes_alpha numeric value specify transparency nodes fill. nodes_label logical value show labels nodes. nodes_label_miny numeric value specify minimum y (frequency) show labels. nodes_width numeric value specify width nodes. links_palette character string specify palette links fill. links_palcolor character vector specify colors links fill. links_alpha numeric value specify transparency links fill. legend.box character string specify box legend, either "vertical" "horizontal". x_text_angle Angle x-axis text aspect.ratio Aspect ratio plot panel legend.position Legend position: "none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top" legend.direction Legend direction: "horizontal" "vertical" flip logical value flip plot. theme Theme name (string) theme function theme_args List arguments passed theme function title Plot title subtitle Plot subtitle xlab X-axis label ylab Y-axis label facet_by Column name(s) faceting plot facet_scales Scales facets: "fixed", "free", "free_x", "free_y" facet_ncol Number columns facet layout facet_nrow Number rows facet layout facet_byrow Fill facets row (TRUE) column (FALSE) seed Random seed reproducibility combine Whether combine split plots one nrow Number rows combining plots ncol Number columns combining plots byrow Fill combined plots row axes handle axes combined plots ("keep", "collect", "collect_x", "collect_y") axis_titles handle axis titles combined plots guides handle guides combined plots ("collect", "keep", "auto") design Custom layout design combined plots ... arguments pass ggalluvial::geom_alluvium ggalluvial::geom_flow.

SankeyPlot(as.data.frame(UCBAdmissions),   x = c("Gender", "Dept"),   y = "Freq", nodes_width = 1 / 12, links_fill_by = "Admit", nodes_label = TRUE,   nodes_palette = "simspec", links_palette = "Set1", links_alpha = 0.5,   nodes_palcolor = "black", links_color = "transparent" )   data(HairEyeColor, package = "datasets") SankeyPlot(as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),   x = c("Hair", "Eye", "Sex"),   y = "Freq", links_fill_by = "Eye", nodes_width = 1 / 8, nodes_alpha = 0.4,   flip = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, knot.pos = 0, links_color = "transparent",   ylab = "Freq", links_alpha = 0.5, links_name = "Eye (links)", links_palcolor = c(     Brown = "#70493D", Hazel = "#E2AC76", Green = "#3F752B", Blue = "#81B0E4"   ) )   data(Refugees, package = "alluvial") country_regions <- c(   Afghanistan = = "Central Africa",   Syria = "Middle East",   Vietnam = "Southeast Asia" ) Refugees$region <- country_regions[Refugees$country] SankeyPlot(Refugees,   x = "year", y = "refugees", alluvium = of origin" )   data(majors, package = "ggalluvial") majors$curriculum <- as.factor(majors$curriculum) SankeyPlot(majors,   x = "semester", stratum = "curriculum", alluvium = "student",   links_fill_by = "curriculum", flow = TRUE, stat = "alluvium", nodes_palette = "Set2",   links_palette = "Set2" )   data(vaccinations, package = "ggalluvial") vaccinations <- transform(vaccinations,   response = title: Spatial Plotting Functions for ggforge ‚Äî spatialplots
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a simple raster library(terra) r <- rast(ncols = 100, nrows = 100, xmin = 0, xmax = 100, ymin = 0, ymax = 100) values(r) <- runif(ncell(r))  # Plot raster image SpatImagePlot(r, palette = "viridis")  # Plot with custom extent SpatImagePlot(r, ext = c(20, 80, 20, 80), palette = "turbo") } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a mask raster library(terra) r <- rast(ncols = 50, nrows = 50, xmin = 0, xmax = 50, ymin = 0, ymax = 50) values(r) <- sample(0:3, ncell(r), replace = TRUE)  # Plot masks with borders SpatMasksPlot(r, add_border = TRUE, palette = "Set2") } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create polygon data library(terra) v <- vect("POLYGON ((0 0, 10 0, 10 10, 0 10, 0 0))")  # Plot shapes SpatShapesPlot(v, fill_by = "grey80", border_color = "black")  # Plot with data.frame poly_df <- data.frame(   x = c(0, 10, 10, 0),   y = c(0, 0, 10, 10),   group = rep(1, 4) ) SpatShapesPlot(poly_df, x = "x", y = "y", group = "group") } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create spatial point data spatial_data <- data.frame(   x = runif(1000, 0, 100),   y = runif(1000, 0, 100),   cluster = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), 1000, replace = TRUE),   value = rnorm(1000) )  # Basic point plot SpatPointsPlot(spatial_data, x = "x", y = "y", color_by = "cluster")  # Continuous color scale SpatPointsPlot(spatial_data, x = "x", y = "y", color_by = "value", palette = "viridis")  # Hex binning for large datasets SpatPointsPlot(spatial_data, x = "x", y = "y", color_by = "value", hex = TRUE)  # Add labels SpatPointsPlot(spatial_data,   x = "x", y = "y", color_by = "cluster",   label = TRUE, label_repel = TRUE ) } # }
